blog.description: Howdy y’all, I'm Richard. I'm a college student from the Texas Hill Country. Currently residing in Houston.

body:
The Road Trip

Peter, recording himself from the back seat: And then they became horribly lost.

Pepper: Are we lost!?

Tony: No!

Peter, still recording: He lied.

Tony: Stop it!

tags: enjoy this weird-ass super short AU
built entirely around that last line
glad to at least b TRYING to write something
summary: Peter had heard of the ‘Spider-Man’ before. Queens’ own personal bigfoot, a blurry image swinging past a shaking phone, or a...
body:
Peter had heard of the ‘Spider-Man’ before. Queens’ own personal bigfoot, a blurry image swinging past a shaking phone, or a shadow snagging burglars with a web from a camera’s blindspot. Just another vigilante with a gimmick.

When the Bugle posted its offer for clear, clean, verifiable images of the Spider-Man, Peter’s interest was piqued. The reward was a lot of money. A lot of money. Enough money to fed off the circling bill collectors wanting to be compensated for all the treatments that couldn’t even save Uncle Ben.

He approached it like an astronomer tracking objects in space. Invisible and unseen but their presence still felt. Tracked reports of stalkers and muggers found hanging from streetlights, carjackers with their hands stuck to the cars they were trying to make off with, drug dealers writhing in webs with their product. It took weeks to plot them all, sift through the raw data, wrote predictive models freehand during his lunch breaks to crunch all the numbers and come up with the most likely places the ‘Spider-Man’ might show up. 

MJ frowned at the map of Queens he had hanging on his wall, which at this point was more thumbtacks and colored strings like crazed conspiracy theorists on TV had. Asked him if all his math was telling him how dangerous it could be trying to track a costumed vigilante around New York City. 

He…might have snapped at her a little. Between double-shifts and all this late-night research there wasn’t much time for sleep. There might also have been some resentment leaking in there too. MJ was doing her own thing- new gigs and minor theater roles, she said- and their busy schedules could never really align. Peter was tired, worried about Aunt May and their piling bills all the time, and he missed his best friend. Things would be better once he got this prize money. 

Except…maybe MJ had a point, a little. One thing Peter hadn’t taken into account when he starting staking out the most likely spots on his models: 71% of all ‘Spider-Man’ sightings were usually where some kind of crime was happening. And a skinny guy with glasses lugging bags and camera equipment by himself into secluded locations could be categorized as ‘high likelihood of something bad happening.’

Peter never thought he’d actually miss Flash Thompson shoving him into lockers during passing period. High School sucked, but at least no one had ever drawn a knife on him. Still, Mr. Knife was just as surprised as he was when a bundle of white, sticky web snagged the guy’s knife hand and yanked him so hard backwards, he went flying.

Still in shock, Peter stood there in frozen. Not taking any pictures, camera clutched to his chest like a lady with her pearls while his would-be attacker dangled above, bound and gagged in webbing, off a fire escape. Up there, balanced impossibly on a narrow safely rail, a masked figure in a figure-hiding baggy blue hoodie looked down at him.

“Face it, Tiger: you just hit the jackpot.”

summary:
Peter, on Titan: Mr. Stark, I guess you could say that I’m the ozone layer
Tony, in tears: What? Why?
Peter, turning to ash:...
body:
Peter, on Titan: Mr. Stark, I guess you could say that I’m the ozone layer

Tony, in tears: What? Why?

Peter, turning to ash: Because I’m disappearing at an alarming rate

blog.name: babyhedgehog-cutebutdeadly
blog.title: Baby Hedgehogs are freakin' adorable.
blog.description: I made this blog in middle school, and the only reason I haven't changed the color scheme is to make you suffer as I have. :) I also had a hedgehog phase.

body:
Spider-Man Fic Help Request

Idea.

Remember the backpack that Peter lost in Homecoming? I don’t remember him ever finding it (if he did, I’m officially pretending he didn’t). What ifffff Hydra found it and linked it to Spider-Man? What if it had something in it (a flyer, maybe?) that makes them realize that Spider-Man is a TEENAGER that attends Midtown High? So then they send a couple agents to go find him, because it can’t be that hard, right?

Wrong.

They infiltrate the school and put it on lockdown and are all like “We know Spider-Man is a student here. Give him to us.”

The school, collectively, basically says “loooool fuck no.”

Cue a bunch of Home Alone-esque pranks pulled on Hydra by the students. Let’s pretend that these Hydra guys are not willing to actually hurt any of the kids.

  • The Hydra guys are going around the school, trying to match each student with some kinda search parameter, while the students AND TEACHERS are just pranking the hell out of em.
  • Bullies use their intimidation tactics on fully grown men. The chemistry department makes a bunch of stink bombs and chucks them at them.
  • Flash starts up a chant of “Herpes Hydra” (along the lines of “Penis Parker”).
  • Kids in the cafeteria band together with the lunch ladies to make a series of edible projectiles.
  • Someone takes a bag of marbles from a physics classroom and spreads them all out down a hallway.
  • Someone else hooks up a rope from the gym at some entrance and the Hydra guys get hella clotheslined.

What else?? This is a school full of teenagers, and I have no doubt that they collectively came up with HUNDREDS of ideas in the face of a common enemy. :)


(Bonus-

MJ: Peter, why are you tearing up?

Peter: *completely moved by the school’s support* No reason, there’s just something in my eye. Those pesky emotions.)

body:
Tony: And this is my… son.

Peter: Hi! I’m Peter! Oh my god are you… (rambling)

Tony: I think he’s actually part golden retriever though.
